summary: I still can't believe that Jon's real name is Aegon Targaryen. I watched The story of House Targaryen promo and when Lyanna...
body: I still can’t believe that Jon’s real name is Aegon Targaryen. I watched The story of House Targaryen promo and when Lyanna whispered Jon’s real name I just started laughing, because it’s so ridicuolus. :D

blog.name: kallypsowrites
blog.title: Kallypso Thoughts
blog.description: Welcome to the messy mind of an author, English teacher and maybe an adult. I post writing stuff sometimes. Mostly I reblog memes

summary: Man, I can’t stop thinking about that Targaryen video. Okay, okay, so...here’s the thing. Game of Thrones has been known to hype...
body:
Man, I can’t stop thinking about that Targaryen video.

Okay, okay, so…here’s the thing. Game of Thrones has been known to hype stuff in the promotional material that doesn’t happen in the show. For instance, they tried to fake us out with Dark! Sansa and that didn’t happen. They tried to fake us out with ‘Jon is really dead’ and that did not happen. But the wierd thing about the dark tone of the Targaryen video is that its…kind of an outlier?

Like all the other promotional material for Daenerys in the past seasons has been positive. She’s always been presented in a pretty heroic light, or at least in as heroic a light as everyone else. And even the promotional material in this seasion doesn’t suggest Targ!bowl. There is very little talk about ‘what will the truth of Jon’s parentage do?’ At most there’s a suggestion that Sansa might not like Daenerys “at first”. But no conflict between Dany in Jon. According to the interviews and magazines they are together! They are in love! Not so secret lovers! United to save the world!

And this video…has a totally different tone. And I don’t know if it was incompetence or something intentional at this point but…let’s talk about it for a second.

Disclaimer before we go into this: This is not a hating on Daenerys post. I’ve said before that I am pretty neutral on her character and I do not have a ship influencing me in this case. As usual I am going to try to be objective and just look at the video as I see it.

1. A Word on Video Editing

You can make ANY character seem heroic/evil with video editing. Just pick the right music and choose the right clips and its easy. I could make all of the Game of Thrones characters look evil if I wanted to. And I’ve watched a lot of Game of Thrones tributes including Hero!Dany tributes AND Dark!Dany tributes. They’re all very well executed and well done videos!

I discussed in my post on ‘the many readings of Daenerys’ that Hero!Dany fans mostly pay attention to her good deeds. Freeing slaves, locking away her dragons when they get out of control, her moments of mercy etc. On the other hand Dark! Dany fans focus primarily on her bad deeds. The more aggressive burnings and executions for example, and the fact that she seems to struggle more with ruling that conquering. But what I hope I made clear is that her good points and bad points BOTH EXIST. I hate to quote Stannis here (because I don’t like him) but “a good deed does not wash out the bad, nor the bad the good”. What determines a character’s story is whether they give into their darker impulses or their better impulses. Theorists argue, of course, over which of Dany’s qualities matter more.

Video editing is the same you pick what clips you want to focus on. You pick the lines. You pick the music. And who ever edited this video was focusing way more on a darker Daenerys.

So this Targaryen video was so similar to so many of the Dark! Dany tributes because of the clips they selected. They could have easily done a heroic Dany tribute. Pick clips of her emotionally vulnerable moments! Pick clips of her freeing the slaves! Pick clips of her vowing to help Jon whether he bends the knee or not! Pick clips of her and Jon being united with one cause! There’s plenty to choose from. But what does the video choose?

First off, they spent almost a full minute on Aerys! And not Aerys alone. They also showed clips of Daenerys intersperced with him. So this isn’t a situation of Aerys is the past but Daenerys is the future. She is put along side her father in the video. It’s quick, but it was a choice.

Second off, most of the scenes they picked involve Daenerys as the aggressor. There are exceptions like the Mhysa clip. But mostly its stuff with Daenerys riding her dragons and burning things. Then there’s the lines they choose to include. “If you choose to melt castles and burn cities, you’re no different. You’re just more of the same” says Jon Snow, over a clip of Daenerys’ dragons setting things on fire, followed swiftly by a close up threatening shot of Drogon’s teeth. They didn’t choose Jon petting the dragon here. They chose the threatening part before.

They also, toward the end, include Tyrion and Varys conversation. “Daenerys is not her father.” “And she never will be with the right council. You need to make her listen”. This implies that Daenerys listening is still a big issue and also implies that she COULD become like her father. Once again, there are any number of other lines they could have chosen. Such as “she checks her worse impulses” or “children are not their fathers, lucky for us”. But they went with that.

Some of the lines they have are morally neutral. Like Tyrion’s line about Daenerys’ story. And the ‘breaking the wheel’ line which I think is an overall positive idea, depending on how Dany actually does it. There is also the “a Targaryen alone in the world is a terrible thing” line, which could be considered more sympathetic if not for the absolutely sinister music that plays beneath when he suggested “no one to guide her”. This seems to imply that Daenerys’ lack of guidance and having to make it on her own might be what nudged her toward her darker impulses? But there’s very little of her softer, kinder side in this video. There is very little of her heroic side in this video.

And then of course…there’s how they chose to end it. Not with Daenerys…but with Jon.

How a video ends is important. The last line is what we remember. And in this case we end with “he is the heir to the iron throne” in reference to Jon. As if to “correct” Dany shortly after she has said “I am the last Targaryen”. This, more than anything, makes it seem like Dany isn’t going to take the reveal all to well. To be fair, I don’t think anyone would.

But the video in isolation isn’t all that matters. Let’s talk about…

2) How it compares to the other videos

If the Stark video was also more sinister than it could just be a tone problem. But there is not one sinister thing in the Stark video. The music his heroic. There is no hint of a conflict between the Starks. No clips of when they have been in opposistion. Only clips of them being seperated but then coming back together as one. We end the video with: ‘the pack survives’ which suggested the Starks are going to be united. And Jon starts the video as well! He is more involved in the Stark video than the Targaryen (and wasn’t included in the ‘a Targaryen alone in the world is a terrible thing’ clip in the first video). It certainly shows some of the ‘darker’ Stark acts but not with any sort of sinister tone.

It is also the ONLY VIDEO that really involves the Others in any capacity. The Others, the main threat, could have easily been included in the Targaryen video as part of her destiny. But instead they make it seem primarily like a Stark problem that they must face together.

The Lannister video is, naturally, sinister, because it has Cersei who is a known villain. But it’s got a similar kind of music beneath it which makes the choices in the Lannister and Targaryen video seem similar? As if they are both a threat? It’s very strange.

In Conclusion:

I don’t think this video proves anything, because promotion is always full of curve balls. But the choice can’t be dismissed. It might not foreshadow a Dark! Dany so much as a conflict between Jon and Dany when they find out. Maybe they’ll do a fakeout like with the Stark sister drama, but then they’ll come back together again. Or maybe HBO is trying to subtly prepare us for Dark!Dany

Nothing is certain til Season 8 drops. But since Daenerys has been marketed as a hero almost exclusively, this video did surprise me. So I’m not ruling out any of the possibilities I talked about in my Daenerys parallels post. They’re all still free game. But this one is the first of the promo videos to tilt in favor of Dark Daenerys. We’ll see how she looks in the trailer!

Pick clips of her emotionally vulnerable moments! Pick clips of her freeing the slaves! Pick clips of her vowing to help Jon whether he bends the knee or not! Pick clips of her and Jon being united with one cause! There’s plenty to choose from. But what does the video choose?

First off, they spent almost a full minute on Aerys! And not Aerys alone. They also showed clips of Daenerys intersperced with him. So this isn’t a situation of Aerys is the past but Daenerys is the future. She is put along side her father in the video. It’s quick, but it was a choice.

Second off, most of the scenes they picked involve Daenerys as the aggressor. There are exceptions like the Mhysa clip. But mostly its stuff with Daenerys riding her dragons and burning things. Then there’s the lines they choose to include. “If you choose to melt castles and burn cities, you’re no different. You’re just more of the same” says Jon Snow, over a clip of Daenerys’ dragons setting things on fire, followed swiftly by a close up threatening shot of Drogon’s teeth. They didn’t choose Jon petting the dragon here. They chose the threatening part before.

They also, toward the end, include Tyrion and Varys conversation. “Daenerys is not her father.” “And she never will be with the right council. You need to make her listen”. This implies that Daenerys listening is still a big issue and also implies that she COULD become like her father. Once again, there are any number of other lines they could have chosen. Such as “she checks her worse impulses” or “children are not their fathers, lucky for us”. But they went with that.

Some of the lines they have are morally neutral. Like Tyrion’s line about Daenerys’ story. And the ‘breaking the wheel’ line which I think is an overall positive idea, depending on how Dany actually does it. There is also the “a Targaryen alone in the world is a terrible thing” line, which could be considered more sympathetic if not for the absolutely sinister music that plays beneath when he suggested “no one to guide her”. This seems to imply that Daenerys’ lack of guidance and having to make it on her own might be what nudged her toward her darker impulses? But there’s very little of her softer, kinder side in this video. There is very little of her heroic side in this video.

And then of course…there’s how they chose to end it. Not with Daenerys…but with Jon.

How a video ends is important. The last line is what we remember. And in this case we end with “he is the heir to the iron throne” in reference to Jon. As if to “correct” Dany shortly after she has said “I am the last Targaryen”. This, more than anything, makes it seem like Dany isn’t going to take the reveal all to well. To be fair, I don’t think anyone would.

But the video in isolation isn’t all that matters. Let’s talk about…

2) How it compares to the other videos

If the Stark video was also more sinister than it could just be a tone problem. But there is not one sinister thing in the Stark video. The music his heroic. There is no hint of a conflict between the Starks. No clips of when they have been in opposistion. Only clips of them being seperated but then coming back together as one. We end the video with: ‘the pack survives’ which suggested the Starks are going to be united. And Jon starts the video as well! He is more involved in the Stark video than the Targaryen (and wasn’t included in the ‘a Targaryen alone in the world is a terrible thing’ clip in the first video). It certainly shows some of the ‘darker’ Stark acts but not with any sort of sinister tone.

It is also the ONLY VIDEO that really involves the Others in any capacity. The Others, the main threat, could have easily been included in the Targaryen video as part of her destiny. But instead they make it seem primarily like a Stark problem that they must face together.

The Lannister video is, naturally, sinister, because it has Cersei who is a known villain. But it’s got a similar kind of music beneath it which makes the choices in the Lannister and Targaryen video seem similar? As if they are both a threat? It’s very strange.

In Conclusion:

I don’t think this video proves anything, because promotion is always full of curve balls. But the choice can’t be dismissed. It might not foreshadow a Dark! Dany so much as a conflict between Jon and Dany when they find out. Maybe they’ll do a fakeout like with the Stark sister drama, but then they’ll come back together again. Or maybe HBO is trying to subtly prepare us for Dark!Dany

Nothing is certain til Season 8 drops. But since Daenerys has been marketed as a hero almost exclusively, this video did surprise me. So I’m not ruling out any of the possibilities I talked about in my Daenerys parallels post. They’re all still free game. But this one is the first of the promo videos to tilt in favor of Dark Daenerys. We’ll see how she looks in the trailer!

summary:
This was meant to be posted yesterday, but Tumblr ate my post, so it had to be redone from scratch 😑
Anyway, here's my take on...
body:
This was meant to be posted yesterday, but Tumblr ate my post, so it had to be redone from scratch 😑

Anyway, here’s my take on that Targ House history video. The first part of it is about the Mad King, the second is about Viserys. The story about Daenerys sets off with Tyrion narrating about her birth. Now, please, tell me, how can anyone mistake it for a hero’s journey?

“When I was a young man, I heard a story about a baby born during the worst storm in living memory”. (ominous thunder clap) “She had no wealth, no lands, no army - only her name”. (ominous thunder clap intensifies).

^^ Truly a cheerful start.

“Then a few years later, this girl without wealth, lands, or armies has somehow acquired all three in a very short span of time”. (ominous dragon screeching)

^This is a vision of Goodness. It makes me feel inspired to do Good Things™

“Along with three dragons”

“Dracarys”

^^ Don’t look at me. I’m staying silent on this one.

“They are not beasts to me. No matter how big they get, how terrifying to everyone else. They are my children”

Awww.

“If you use them to melt castles and burn cities, you are not different. You are just more of the same”. (Somehow Jon doesn’t sound inspired)

Doesn’t look inspired, too.

PS: they made him look like he’s facing off Drogon like a threat.

“The world haven’t seen a dragon in centuries, until my children were born”.

^^ Some random clueless Targ stan probably: “She is talking about her beautiful babies. Why instead we get the imagery of an ugly black flag? This is D&D just being stupid again.😒 ”

“The Dothraki haven’t crossed the sea. They did for me”.

“I was born to rule the Seven Kingdoms. And I will”.

^^ I’ve always wondered - did they tell Emilia to talk baring her teeth like that? She looks like she’s growling at Jon, like a dragon.

“You have your armies. You have your ships. You have your dragons”.

^^ I’m staying silent on this one too. This must be another vision of Goodness™

“You are in the great game now. And the great game is terrifying”.

^^ Erm, Tyrion? I don’t think she looks properly apprehensive and appreciative of your wisdom here.

Part 2 to come.

summary: SOOOOOOOOOOO... guys, I need your help. I’m writing a paper on Game of Thrones for university and I need two more people I’ll be...
body: SOOOOOOOOOOO… guys, I need your help. I’m writing a paper on Game of Thrones for university and I need two more people I’ll be able to interview. The whole process will be completley anoymous, none of your data will be collected or stored anywhere. If you are a Game of Thornes anti, you are also welcomed, as we are activley searching for both, fans and anti-fans to be interviewed. If you don’t wan’t to participate, it be great if you could give this a boost, I’d really appreciate the help!
